definition: to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game

sentences.english: Thus, we have put short quiz to a climax.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我们把短片竞猜这一部分推向了高潮。

sentences.english: The prospect of guessing sports lottery has a better market.
sentences.chinese: 竞猜类体育彩票具有良好的市场前景。

sentences.english: But the reports say people will be able to win small prizes in a convoluted process described as a guessing game.
sentences.chinese: 但是报道称，人们可以在有奖竞猜中赢得较小的奖励。

sentences.english: When it came to the quiz program, everyone gave their points of view on it .
sentences.chinese: 谈到竞猜节目的时候，每个人都发表各自的意见。

sentences.english: Welcome to the palace of wisdom. (
sentences.chinese: 欢迎来到智慧宫有奖竞猜。

sentences.english: We have ample time to prepare for the contest.
sentences.chinese: 我们有充裕的时间为竞猜做准备。

definition: to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
to compete to answer questions (in class)
to announce the winners in a lottery
to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)
to win a prize/a successful gamble
(usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
to guess correctly/to figure out the right answer
to win (a prize in a lottery)
painted eggshell/Easter egg/(media) Easter egg (hidden feature in software or a movie etc)/post-credits scene
to throw one's energies (into an activity)/to invest one's emotions (in sth)/to bet/betting
